Study.Citation: Mayer, F.S. & McPherson Frantz, C. (2004). The connectedness to nature scale: A measure of individualsâ feeling in community with nature. Journal of Environmental Psychology, 24, 503-515.

License.de: Frei verfügbar für Forschungszwecke (mit Originalpublikation überprüfen)

Instructions.en: Please read each statement and select the response that best describes you.
Instructions.de: Bitte lesen Sie jede Aussage und wählen Sie die Antwort, die Sie am besten beschreibt.

Description.en: I often feel a sense of oneness with the natural world around me.
Description.de: I often feel a sense of oneness with the natural world around me.

Description.en: I think of the natural world as a community to which I belong.
Description.de: I think of the natural world as a community to which I belong.

Description.en: I recognize and appreciate the intelligence of other living organisms.
Description.de: I recognize and appreciate the intelligence of other living organisms.

Description.en: When I think of my life, I imagine myself to be part of a larger cyclical process of living.
Description.de: When I think of my life, I imagine myself to be part of a larger cyclical process of living.

Description.en: I often feel a kinship with animals and plants.
Description.de: I often feel a kinship with animals and plants.

Description.en: I feel as though I belong to the Earth as equally as it belongs to me.
Description.de: I feel as though I belong to the Earth as equally as it belongs to me.

Description.en: I have a deep understanding of how my actions affect the natural world.
Description.de: I have a deep understanding of how my actions affect the natural world.

Description.en: I often feel part of the web of life.
Description.de: I often feel part of the web of life.

Description.en: I feel that all inhabitants of Earth, human, and nonhuman, share a common âlife forceâ.
Description.de: I feel that all inhabitants of Earth, human, and nonhuman, share a common âlife forceâ.

Description.en: Like a tree can be part of a forest, I feel embedded within the broader natural world.
Description.de: Like a tree can be part of a forest, I feel embedded within the broader natural world.

Description.en: I often feel like I am only a small part of the natural world around me, and that I am no more important than the grass on the ground or the birds in the trees.
Description.de: I often feel like I am only a small part of the natural world around me, and that I am no more important than the grass on the ground or the birds in the trees.
